description: Erection of single storey rear and first floor side extension
decision_conditions: The proposed first floor side extension would result in the total loss of the cat-slide roof which is a distinct feature of properties along Holmsley Close and the wider area. The proposed first floor side extension would be harmful to the character and appearance of the existing dwelling and street scene. The proposal would be contrary to Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Council LDF Core Strategy, 2012 and Policy Guidance 37 of the Council's Residential Design SPD, 2013 and the NPPF 2019.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation. These cover such works as - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a newbuilding or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works. Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts. A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Annotated dimensions - all Existing and Proposed floor plans, site plans, elevation drawings, and section / level plans must include key annotated dimensions, i.e. to show the dimensions of any existing structures to be demolished/retained and dimensions for the proposed works. Please amend and re-submit where necessary.
